oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Coexistence of paramagnetic and superparamagnetic Fe(III) in mesoporous MCM-41 silicates
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SELVAM, P
DAPURKAR, SE
BADAMALI, SK
MURUGASAN, M
KUWANO, H
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: iron-containing mcm-41
molecular-sieves
fe2o3 nanoparticles
template
catalysis
chemistry
mcm-41
mesoporous molecular sieves
iron oxide nanoclusters
paramagnetism
superparamagnetism
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In the present study, we demonstrate the coexistence of paramagnetic and superparamagnetic Fe(III) in mesoporous MCM-41 matrix. The loading of trivalent iron in MCM-41 not only results in the formation of iron oxide nanoclusters in the mesovoids, but also substitutes (isomorphously) in the silicate matrix. The resulting non-framework and framework Fe(III) exhibit superparamagnetic and paramagnetic properties, respectively. The dual behaviour of Fe(III) in MCM-41 is deduced using various analytical and spectroscopic techniques, viz. X-ray diffraction (XRD), diffuse reflectance ultraviolet-visible (DRUV-VIS), electron paramagnetic resonance (EPR) and Mossbauer spectroscopy. (C) 2001 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Workshop on Nanostructured Materials and Catalysis,PERTH, AUSTRALIA,JUL 09-12, 2000
